      • insertStatements

        public void insertStatements(java.lang.String serializedStatements,
                    java.lang.String format,
                    java.lang.String base)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Insert data into the default graph of the remote KB.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • insertStatements

        public void insertStatements(java.lang.String serializedStatements,
                    java.lang.String format,
                    java.lang.String base,
                    boolean verifyData)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Insert data into the default graph of the remote KB.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        verifyData - Whether or not to verify that the data is valid before inserting statements
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • internalInsertStatements

        protected void internalInsertStatements(java.lang.Object serializedStatements,
                            java.lang.String format,
                            java.lang.String base,
                            java.lang.String namedGraphURI,
                            boolean verifyData)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Insert data into the remote KB in the specified named graph.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form. This should be either a String or an InputStream.
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the graph to insert into
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createNamedGraph

        public void createNamedGraph(java.lang.String namedGraphURI)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createNamedGraph

        public void createNamedGraph(java.lang.String namedGraphURI,
                    boolean silent)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        silent - The SPARQL/Update service generates an error if the graph referred by the URI already exists unless the SILENT is set to true, then no error is generated and execution of the sequence of SPARQL/Update operations continues.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dropNamedGraph

        public void dropNamedGraph(java.lang.String namedGraphURI)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Drops the specified named graph from the repository (this can handle dropping Union graphs as well).
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to drop
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dropNamedGraph

        public void dropNamedGraph(java.lang.String namedGraphURI,
                  boolean silent)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Drops the specified named graph from the repository (this can handle dropping Union graphs as well).
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to drop
        silent - The SPARQL/Update service, by default, is expected to generate an error if the specified named graph does not exist. If SILENT is true, this error is ignored and execution of a sequence of SPARQL/Update operations continues.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createNamedUnionGraph

        public void createNamedUnionGraph(java.lang.String namedUnionGraphURI,
                         java.lang.String leftGraphURI,
                         java.lang.String rightGraphURI)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new Union named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedUnionGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        leftGraphURI - The first named graph in the union
        rightGraphURI - The second named graph in the union
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getAvailableNamedGraphs()
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Get an iterator of the available named graphs within the system.
        Returns:
        an Iterator of Strings representing uris for the named graphs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • clear

        public void clear(java.lang.String namedGraphURI)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Clears all of the statements in the given named graph. Note: does not remove the named graph itself.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - URI of the named graph to clear
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
